Namespaces

namespace  glm

Functions

double glm::acos (double x)
 Arc cosine. Returns an angle whose sine is x. The range of values returned by this function is [0, PI]. Results are undefined if |x| > 1. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::asin (double x)
 Arc sine. Returns an angle whose sine is x. The rqnge of values returned by this function is [-PI/2, PI/2]. Results are undefined if |x| > 1. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::atan (double y_over_x)
 Arc tangent. Returns an angle whose tangent is y_over_x. The range of values returned by this function is [-PI/2, PI/2]. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::atan (double y, double x)
 Arc tangent. Returns an angle whose tangent is y/x. The signs of x and y are used to determine what quadrant the angle is in. The range of values returned by this function is [-PI, PI]. Results are undefined if x and y are both 0. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::ceil (double x)
 Returns a value equal to the nearest integer that is greater than or equal to x. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::cos (double angle)
 The standard trigonometric cosine function. The values returned by this function will range from [-1, 1]. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::degrees (double radians)
 Converts radians to degrees and returns the result. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::dot (double v1, double v2)
 Returns the dot product of x and y, i.e., result = x * y. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::exp (double x)
 Returns the natural exponentiation of x, i.e., e^x. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::exp2 (double x)
 Returns 2 raised to the x power. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::faceforward (double N, double I, double Nref)
 If dot(Nref, I) < 0.0, return N, otherwise, return -N. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::floor (double x)
 Returns a value equal to the nearest integer that is less then or equal to x. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::fract (double x)
 Return x - floor(x). (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::inversesqrt (double x)
 Returns the reciprocal of the positive square root of x. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::length (double x)
 Returns the length of x, i.e., sqrt(x * x). (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::log (double x)
 Returns the natural logarithm of x, i.e., returns the value y which satisfies the equation x = e^y. Results are undefined if x <= 0. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::log2 (double x)
 Returns the base 2 log of x, i.e., returns the value y, which satisfies the equation x = 2 ^ y. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::mix (double x, double y, double a)
 Returns x * (1.0 - a) + y * a, i.e., the linear blend of x and y using the floating-point value a. The value for a is not restricted to the range [0, 1]. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::mod (double x, double y)
 Modulus. Returns x - y * floor(x / y) for each component in x using the floating point value y. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::noise1 (double x)
 Returns a 1D noise value based on the input value x. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::pow (double x, double y)
 Returns x raised to the y power. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::radians (double degrees)
 Converts degrees to radians and returns the result. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::reflect (double I, double N)
 For the incident vector I and surface orientation N, returns the reflection direction : result = I - 2.0 * dot(N, I) * N. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::refract (double I, double N, double eta)
 For the incident vector I and surface normal N, and the ratio of indices of refraction eta, return the refraction vector. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::sin (double angle)
 The standard trigonometric sine function. The values returned by this function will range from [-1, 1]. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::smoothstep (double edge0, double edge1, double x)
 Returns 0.0 if x <= edge0 and 1.0 if x >= edge1 and performs smooth Hermite interpolation between 0 and 1 when edge0 < x, edge1. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::sqrt (double x)
 Returns the positive square root of x. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::step (double edge, double x)
 Returns 0.0 if x <= edge; otherwise, it returns 1.0. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
double glm::tan (double angle)
 The standard trigonometric tangent function. (from GLM_GTX_double extension).
